text:
But I am the worst b/c when he tried to do a proper proposal with a ring, down on one knee. I told him I wanted a speech. Then after he did that. I decided I wanted to get in on the fun and propose to him, so then I got down on one knee. 

He's a pretty chill guy
author: Neda_Semnani

text: And then we laughed a lot because he's the best
author: Neda_Semnani

text:
Then I couldn't sleep because I was going through it about marriage and gender roles, etc. So I awoke and announced: TO BE CLEAR I AM NOT YOUR CATTLE. 

He very calmly replied, do you mean my chattle?

To which, I said: WHATEVER YOU DO NOT OWN MY MILK FOR FREE
author: Neda_Semnani

text: We had been talking about getting domestically partnered, then, in between episodes of YOU, he said "What if instead of going to city hall to get DPed, we go to city hall to get married instead?" And I said "are you asking me to marry you?" He said, "i guess." 1/2
author: Neda_Semnani

text: It wouldn't have worked with another kind of person except for powerful, older white pol/power guy. And no one but her sort could've pulled it off -- she was trying to be like so many different kinds of men/male stereotypes

text: Watching people's minds expand and explode while listening to @SuzannahLessard speak is one of my favorite things in life. #absenthand
author: Neda_Semnani

text:
Fascinating conversation about the intersection of imagination, landscape, nuclear science, slavery and American identity. Talking craft of nonfiction and communicating big, fat ideas.

#absenthand
author: Neda_Semnani

text:
@JacobLevenson1 asks @SuzannahLessard: "how doslavery and nuclear power intersect?"

Lessard: "They are the basis for the [idea of] American exceptionalism" #absenthand
author: Neda_Semnani

text: "This is the tragic side of human nature. Its not only about race: you can be enslaved or you can enslave others. That's what the landscape was tell me." @SuzannahLessard #absenthand
author: Neda_Semnani

text: If you had told me yesterday I'd be choked up and tearing after finishing One Plus One's Lennon/McCartney series from @WonderyMedia, i would have said youre crazy. And yet here we are. Trying not to cry in public.
author: Neda_Semnani

text: Aww me, 17, abt to graduate: "This woman inside me is strong, secure, feminine, & masculine. She’s a fighter. She isn’t perfect--perfection is boring, anyway. But what if she isn’t enough? What if it is too hard? What if she crumbles? What then?"
author: Neda_Semnani
